intro: Pavetta cephalotes, commonly known as the white-flowered pavetta, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Pavetta cephalotes is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
